title: Omicron sub-variant BA.2 makes up 85.9% of COVID variants in U.S. - CDC
description: The U.S. national public health agency said on Tuesday the BA.2 sub-variant of Omicron was estimated to account for 85.9% of the coronavirus variants in the country. A resurgence in COVID-19 cases in parts of Asia and Europe has raised concerns that another wave could follow in the United States, but the country's health experts believe it is unlikely.
content:
The U.S. national public health agency said on Tuesday the BA.2 sub-variant of Omicron was estimated to account for 85.9% of the coronavirus variants in the country.

title: Italy reports 83,643 coronavirus cases on Tuesday, 169 deaths
description:
Italy reported 83,643 COVID-19 related cases on Tuesday, against 28,368 the day before, the health ministry said, while the number of deaths rose to 169 from 115.
The total number of intensive care patients edged down to 463 from 466. Some 563,018 tests for COVID-19 were carried out in the past day, sharply down from a previous 192,782, the health ministry said.
content: Italy reported 83,643 COVID-19 related cases on Tuesday, against 28,368 the day before, the health ministry said, while the number of deaths rose to 169 from 115. Italy has registered 161,032 deaths linked to COVID-19 since its outbreak emerged in Fe... [665 chars]

title: Heart complications uncommon for children and young adults after SARS-CoV-2 infection
description: Heart complications are uncommon, yet treatable for children and young adults after COVID-19 disease or SARS-CoV-2 infection, according to a new scientific statement from the American Heart Association that details what has been learned about how to treat, manage and even prevent cardiovascular complications from the SARS-CoV-2 virus in youth.

title: Slashed COVID-19 vaccine Covishield's prices to ensure more accessibility, reach, says SII's Adar Poonawalla
description: The decision to slash the prices of the precautionary dose of the COVID-19 vaccine Covishield, which is now available for all adults, was taken to make it more affordable, accessible and within reach of the masses, Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of Serum Institute of India (SII) Adar Poonawalla said on Tuesday.

title: XE: Should you be worried about the new Covid-19 hybrid?
description: Maybe not yet, but such combinations will become more frequent as Covid-19 evolves.
content: A new hybrid Covid-19 variant dubbed XE has sparked fresh concerns recently. XE is a combination of the highly transmissible BA.1 and BA.2 Omicron variants and was first detected in the United Kingdom in mid-January. Its spike protein derives from BA... [5443 chars]

title: Singapore PM Lee says his govt 'did not get every call right' during COVID-19 crisis, but key is to keep learning
description: Read more about Singapore PM Lee says his govt 'did not get every call right' during COVID-19 crisis, but key is to keep learning on Devdiscourse
content:
Singapore Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong on Tuesday conceded that his government ''did not get every call right'' in the COVID-19 crisis, but assured that the key is to keep learning and “be prepared to make the tough calls”.
